titleStmt.title: Description of The Revelation of St John in Hebrew translation.

availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Sloane MS 237: The Revelation of St John in Hebrew translation. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Universal page for usage details, https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/.

The [British] Library respects the intellectual property rights, including moral rights, of rights holders and makes all reasonable effort to contact and consult rights owners, including, where appropriate, communities directly, or via local community organisations. Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Revelation of St John in Hebrew translation.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Sir Hans Sloane (b. 1660, d. 1753), baronet, physician and collector. Part of the Sloane bequest and incorporated into the newly founded British Museum in 1753.
